title: Protests rocked Israel for 29 consecutive weeks. There’s more to come.
description: In a mass movement that has brought together people from across Israeli society, protesters have closed highways, shut down the largest airport and vowed to keep demonstrating.

title: In Singapore, loud echoes of Beijing’s positions generate anxiety
description: In seeking to incorporate ethnic Chinese citizens of other countries into its vision, Beijing is stoking divided loyalties, critics say.

title: Ukraine remains defiant as Russia pounds Odessa and grain facilities
description: Russian air strikes have pummeled the Ukrainian port city on the Black Sea, damaging a historic church and port infrastructure, while drones struck buildings in Moscow.

title: What’s next for Israel after Netanyahu’s judicial overhaul?
description: In the view of many Israelis, the country’s legal system was one of the only real checks on government power in the country’s weak political system.

title: Election shows Spain still has little interest in re-embracing far right
description: Far-right Vox, instead of playing the predicted role of kingmaker on election night, may have been more of a liability.

title: Far-right government in Israel votes to limit Supreme Court powers
description: In a dramatic and contentious parliamentary session, a judicial reform measure was pushed through despite massive and ongoing civil unrest in Israel.

title: The Nazis had camps on British soil, but the death toll remains unknown
description: The British government will review the Nazi concentration camps on the Channel Islands, a relatively small but crucial part of British Isles Holocaust history.

title: U.N. Command, North Korea in talks about detained U.S. soldier Travis King
description: U.S. soldier Travis King, 23, ran across the border to North Korea from South Korea during a visit to the heavily fortified demilitarized zone.

title: The last of the Thames barges race to save British maritime history
description: The Thames Sailing Barge Match recalls a time when thousands of barges plied the River Thames, transporting cargo under red ocher sails.

title: Israel live updates: Protests ahead of judicial overhaul vote; Netanyahu gets pacemaker
description: The judicial reform vote is scheduled for Monday and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, just fitted with a pacemaker, shows little sign of bending to protests.

title: West Point trained the heir to Cambodia’s autocracy. Who is Hun Manet?
description: Gen. Hun Manet is the eldest son of Hun Sen, whose four decade rule of political oppression and economic growth is set to end after Sunday's election.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Drone strikes skyscraper in Moscow; another night of attacks in Odessa
description: Two drones were downed, the Russian Defense Ministry said, calling the incident a “terrorist attack” perpetrated by Kyiv.

title: The moral dilemma of sending cluster munitions to Ukraine
description: Most of the world has banned the production and use of cluster bombs, but Ukraine sees the U.S.-made weapon as vital against Russian invaders.

title: What to know about Israel’s protests and judicial overhaul plan
description: Israel's parliament will vote on legislation to limit the Supreme Court's oversight powers.
